feedData.title: Cryptocurrency Widely Used To Support Drug Trafficking In Mexico, Says FinCEN
feedData.subTitle:
According to Foresight News, the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) of the US Treasury Department recently stated that cryptocurrencies are being widely used to support drug trafficking activities in Mexico, including the illegal trafficking of fentanyl. The cryptocurrencies involved include Bitcoin, Ethereum, Monero, and USDT. FinCEN has warned American financial companies to be aware of the criminal networks producing these dangerous narcotics.

Cryptocurrencies, due to their anonymous nature, have become a preferred mode of transaction for illegal activities. The US Treasury Department is urging financial institutions to be vigilant and monitor any suspicious activities related to these cryptocurrencies. The use of digital currencies in illegal activities poses a significant challenge to law enforcement agencies worldwide.

The warning from FinCEN comes as part of a broader effort to combat drug trafficking and other illegal activities funded through cryptocurrencies. The agency is working closely with other law enforcement agencies to track and disrupt these criminal networks. The fight against the misuse of cryptocurrencies in illegal activities is a top priority for the US Treasury Department.

Today, BlockDAG (BDAG) offers the same or even greater potential. With user-friendly mining solutions and ongoing presale, BlockDAG holds the potential to replicate the remarkable success seen with Bitcoin. BlockDAGâ€™s presale has already crossed $52.3 million with projections of 30,000x ROI.Â Â

As Bitcoinâ€™s value began to rise, the Illinois developerâ€™s early adoption paid off handsomely. feedData.title: 3 Reasons Bitcoiners Should Also Buy Ethereum, According to Bitwise
feedData.subTitle:
With spot Ethereum ETFs on the horizon in the United States, should existing Bitcoin ETF holders split their crypto holdings into ETH?

In a Twitter thread on Thursday, Bitwise CIO Matt Hougan offered three reasons for why this might be a good idea.

Why Bitcoin Holders Should Buy Ethereum

The first, Hougan wrote, is for the sake of diversification. Since predicting the future of crypto is difficult, holding a stake in both leading assets can provide investors relief in case one asset falls out of favor, or gobbles up the other over time.

â€œAsk any investor from the dot-com boom who bought AOL Pets.com,â€ Hougan said. â€œThey got the overall bet rightâ€”the internet is going to be big!â€”but the specifics wrong. Sad!â€

As of writing, Bitcoinâ€™s market cap accounts for 55% of the entire crypto market, according to TradingView. Ethereum comprises 18.6%.

While ETH has performed generally flat against Bitcoin over the last five years, its dominance against the top crypto has slowly receded since the September 2022 merge. Still, the ETH/BTC ratio received a modest boost when approved to receive a U.S. spot ETF last month.

Secondly, Hougan said the fundamentally different nature of Bitcoin and Ethereum makes it difficult to choose between them. While Bitcoin is optimized towards being â€œbetter money,â€ Ethereum is designed for â€œprogrammable moneyâ€ that enables blockchain applications like stablecoins and DeFi.

â€œAdding some ETH to a majority BTC position gives you broader exposure to all the things public blockchains can do,â€ he said.

BTC And ETH Perform Best Together

Lastly, Hougan said the historical performance of both assets shows that they work best when balanced together in a portfolio.

For example, a â€œtraditionalâ€ 60/40 portfolio with a 5% crypto allocation had a higher cumulative return over the past four years when weighted 70/30 between BTC and ETH allocations (56.32%) than when allocated purely to BTC (54.49%).

Interestingly, it even had a lower â€œmaximum drawdownâ€ than the BTC-only portfolio over that time, only pulling back 25.19% at its peak compared to 25.35%.

Nevertheless, Hougan said there is still a chief reason investors may want to stay BTC only.

â€œItâ€™s very likely that Bitcoin is the dominant new form of â€œmoneyâ€ that emerges in crypto,â€ said Hougan, citing its massive existing lead and community orientation towards this market.

â€œMoney is a massive market. Thereâ€™s plenty of space for BTC to run if it succeeds,â€ he said.

The post 3 Reasons Bitcoiners Should Also Buy Ethereum, According To Bitwise appeared first on CryptoPotato.

feedData.content:
Here are Some Risk Management Tips For YouðŸ‘‡

1. Be aware of transaction fees on different exchanges, as they can impact your profitability. 
2. Choose exchanges with competitive fee structures for your trading volume and frequency. 
3. Factor in withdrawal fees when calculating your potential returns. 
4. Use limit orders instead of market orders to avoid higher fees. 
5. Consider the impact of network congestion on transaction fees, especially for cryptocurrencies with high transaction costs. 
6. Plan your trades to minimize the frequency of transactions, thereby reducing cumulative fees.

feedData.title: MicroStrategy's Ongoing Bitcoin Acquisition
feedData.subTitle: MicroStrategy, a major holder of Bitcoin, has completed a convertible notes offering to purchase more BTC. The company announced the completion of a 2.25% convertible senior notes offering, raising $800 million, with $100 million from an option to purchase. The net proceeds of approximately $786 million will be used to acquire additional Bitcoin and for general corporate purposes. MicroStrategy recently bought 11,931 BTC for $786 million, bringing their total holdings to 226,331 BTC. Despite significant Bitcoin investments, the company reported losses in 2024. MicroStrategy's founder, Michael Saylor, has been actively involved in Bitcoin acquisitions since 2020. The company's strategy of using Bitcoin as its primary reserve currency has led to substantial BTC purchases over time. While MicroStrategy continues to invest in Bitcoin, their financial reports show ongoing losses, highlighting the volatility of the cryptocurrency market. Read more AI-generated news on: https://app.chaingpt.org/news

feedData.content:
ðŸš¨ YOU COULD LOSE EVERYTHING! ðŸš¨

Unless You Understand the Psychology of the Crypto Market

Experts predict a new bull run peaking in late 2025, 12-18 months after the April 2024 halving. Ready to ride the wave? Many wonâ€™t make it. Let's break down the psychological phases:

ðŸ“Œ PHASE 1 - Accumulation: 

During this phase, crypto Whales and OGs buy at discounted rates. New projects emerge amid lingering skepticism. Think back to last year when $BTC was at $15,000 and the market was in turmoil.

ðŸ“Œ PHASE 2 - Momentum:

Weâ€™re here now. Prices climb, excitement builds, HODLers rejoice, FOMO kicks in, and altcoins surge.

ðŸ“Œ PHASE 3 - Euphoria/Excess:

Greed takes over, prices soar daily, mainstream attention grows, and scams emerge. When the Bitcoin Fear and Greed Index hits 90, manage your positions. Be smart or you wonâ€™t see the crash coming.

ðŸ“Œ PHASE 4 - Massive Crash/Long Red Candles:

 Prices plummet, panic selling ensues, media turns negative, Whales and new investors exit, and veterans buy the dip. Noobs are left holding bags for years. DON'T BE THAT PERSON!

â° Tips for Success:

- Invest wisely and patiently.
- Use dollar-cost averaging.
- Take profits on the way up.
- Diversify to avoid overexposure.
- Be cautious of hype and scams.
- Watch for market sentiment changes.
- Hedge positions strategically.
- Keep cash reserves for opportunities.

The coming months are filled with excitement, risks, and rewards. Navigate wisely to achieve life-changing wealth in this crypto revolution!

feedData.title: Bitcoin(BTC) Drops Below 65,000 USDT with a Narrowed 0.06% Increase in 24 Hours
feedData.subTitle: On Jun 20, 2024, 22:40 PM(UTC). According to Binance Market Data, Bitcoin has dropped below 65,000 USDT and is now trading at 64,999.230469 USDT, with a narrowed narrowed 0.06% increase in 24 hours.

translatedData.content:
ðŸ“Š #Bitcoin  Volatility Declines in Long Term, Is It Ready to Become a Currency?

ðŸ”¶ One of the main arguments put forward by detractors of Bitcoin is its high volatility, claiming that it is not a currency. Indeed, Bitcoin is known for its significant price fluctuations, being able to lose or gain 5% of its value in a day and up to 80% in a few months.  

ðŸ”¶ Such uncertainty regarding variations in the value of #BTC  in the short term would prevent its users from relying on this currency to make their daily purchases. However, unlike its capitalization, Bitcoin's volatility has decreased significantly over time.  

ðŸ”¶ According to a study by #Kaiko  Research, although the price of Bitcoin increased from $17,000 at the start of 2023 to more than $73,000 in March 2024, an increase of 330%, its volatility 60-day average has never been lower over such a long period.  

ðŸ”¶ As an indication, the 2 main periods of high volatility of BTC were caused by the Covid-19 crisis in 2020 and by the fall of the Terra ecosystem, followed by the bankruptcy of #FTX  in 2022. We could therefore think that volatility increases mainly when the price is in a sharp decline, while its volatility had also reached a peak of 106% during its 2021 high at $69,000.  

ðŸ”¶ Kaiko Research nevertheless points out that it is too early to consider this trend definitive. Indeed, it is impossible to determine whether Bitcoin will repeat its volatility spikes in the future. However, these figures show that BTC has gained maturity, which proves its investors right and still leaves it with the possibility of becoming an everyday currency.

feedData.title: Bitcoin Crash Below $66,000 Stuns Market, Why A Drop To $54,930 Is Possible
feedData.subTitle:
The Bitcoin price crash below $66,000 has taken the market by surprise, leading to over $90 million in liquidations in a 24-hour period. But even after dropping so much already, analysts do not believe that the worst is over. In particular, crypto analyst Ali Martinez has said that Bitcoin may still have a ways to go before the crash is over, prediction another 20% decline from here.

Bitcoin Falls Below Major Pricing Band

Crypto analyst Ali Martinez posted a new analysis on X (formerly Twitter) on the Bitcoin price that paints a rather bearish picture for the pioneer cryptocurrency. According to Martinez, the Bitcoin crash below $68,000 had actually pushed it below an important level.

Related Reading

The major level of importance here is the $67,890 pricing range, which the price has now fallen below. As Martinez explains, this area is important as the â€œ+0.5Ïƒ MVRV pricing bandâ€ lies here. It also means that a crash below this level is very bearish for the price, and as Martinez shows, Bitcoin has already fallen below it.

This fall puts a bearish motion in place as the crypto analyst believes it may trigger a correction. Now, while corrections are normal, the expectation for how far the crash will go is what is worrying because the analyst has placed a possible $54,930 target for the price.

#Bitcoin has dropped below the +0.5Ïƒ MVRV pricing band at $67,890, which may trigger a correction toward the mean pricing band at $54,930. pic.twitter.com/zZvswgpUpS

â€” Ali (@ali_charts) June 19, 2024

Such a crash would mean that the Bitcoin price would fall another 20% from its current level. Given the previous crashes, this could be devastating for altcoins, whose prices could fall another 50% if BTC were to crash below $55,000.

Navigating The Drop In Interest

One interesting development for Bitcoin is the drop in interest that has been experienced this week. For example, the daily trading volume, according to CoinMarketCap, fell 43.5% in the last day along. This brings the Bitcoin daily trading volume to around $19 billion from the almost $40 billion recorded the previous day.

Related Reading

This drop in trading volume indicates that investors are taking fewer positions. With the uncertainty surrounding the market, this comes as no surprise, given that investors are prone to wait for the situation to improve before taking more positions.

The Crypto Fear & Greed Index has also declined, showing that fear is growing in the market. It is now sitting at a score of 60, which shows greed, a long way from Mayâ€™s score of 76, which showed extreme greed in the market.

At the time of writing, the Bitcoin price is holding at $65,667, with a 0.77% gain in the last day.

BTC price crashes again | Source: BTCUSD on Tradingview.com

Featured image created with Dall.E, chart from Tradingview.com

Source: NewsBTC.com

The post Bitcoin Crash Below $66,000 Stuns Market, Why A Drop To $54,930 Is Possible appeared first on Crypto Breaking News.

feedData.title: Bitcoin Analyst Claims BTC Consolidation Will Continue, Hedge Funds Throw In The Towel
feedData.subTitle:
Dalmas, a seasoned crypto reporter, brings a unique perspective to the industry. His specialization in NFTs, blockchain, DeFi, and blockchain news for NewsBTC, combined with a background in mechanical engineering and over a decade of experience in journalism, has allowed him to craft over 10,000 news and feature articles over the past eight years. His diverse range of topics, including technology, Forex, and finance, reflects his comprehensive understanding of the crypto landscape.

His technical expertise and analytical skills have been recognized and featured by leading news outlets such as Investing.com, CoinTelegraph, Entrepreneur, Forbes, and other authority sites. Notably, he broke key news, including the Ripple and MoneyGram partnership, cementing his position as a thought leader in crypto.
The news exploded. Over 100,000 people devoured this meticulously crafted report, from seasoned investors to curious newcomers. His analysis wasnâ€™t just dry facts and figures; it crackled with insight, dissecting the implications of the partnership and its potential impact on the future of finance.

His deep understanding of the financial markets, technological advancements, and blockchain developments has made him a respected voice in the industry.

Dalmas is also the founder of BTC-Pulse, a crypto news site, further demonstrating his commitment to the field. He firmly believes that DeFi and NFTs are here to stay and will continue to drive financial inclusion.

Coming from Nairobi, Kenya, it is easy to see the source of his inspiration: Across Africa, millions lack access to traditional banks. Remote villages, limited documentation, and high minimum balances create insurmountable barriers.

DeFi, not just Maker or Aave, for example, but think of Bitcoin and USDT, cuts out the middleman. Forget banks with their limitations.
Even so, DeFi isnâ€™t a magic solution. The continent still struggles with reliable internet access, and educational campaigns highlighting the benefits of this wonderful solution are insufficient. Moreover, even for those interested, understanding DeFi can look like learning a new language.

Dalmas is here to help make the tech easy to understand and digestible, even for beginners.
The story of DeFi in Africa is still being written. Challenges abound, but the promise of a more inclusive financial future is a powerful motivator. With innovation and collaboration, Dalmas firmly believes that DeFi could become the key to unlocking Africaâ€™s full economic potential.
This possibility and its immense value motivate Dalmas to continue breaking key DeFi innovations and more across the globe. His engineering background further enhances his ability to deliver well-thought-out pieces that blend technical insight with clear, impactful reporting.

Beyond his professional achievements, Dalmas is deeply passionate about technology and politics. Policies drive adoption, and being at the forefront and keeping up with how they evolve is crucial for the sphere to mature.

When Dalmas is not closely monitoring the latest crypto events, he can be found in nature, exploring the picturesque countryside, and traveling with his family and friends. His love for adventure and discovery perfectly complements his investigative and reporting skills.
You can connect with Dalmas on X: @Dalmas_Ngetich, or contact him on Telegram @Dalmas_Ngetich.

$BTC 
{future}(BTCUSDT)
Take a good look at the second picture!!! In the picture, I have circled the area that should go up to the daily close for #Bitcoin . Now, if it closes below 65165 without a circle in the picture, how do you feel when you look at the candle structure? BTC made a great upward move today, but was knocked unconscious by hitting its head with a shovel and the price was brought down by artificial intelligence sales. If the day closes around the current level of 65 or below, the daily candle structure will take a reverse shape and it will be quite normal for it to carry the decline one level down. In my first analysis today, I said that I expected an upward movement, and this movement came very well. However, just before the halfway point, the US market was crashed with a hard candle, again with an excuse, before its opening. You need to learn this lesson from here. For about 10 days, I have been telling you about summer sales and that cryptocurrency bosses need money for holidays and that holidays in the Bahamas are not cheap. What you need to understand is that if you are not careful, they will make you pay these holiday money out of your pocket :))) If your account is strong, there is no problem, but if you are making high leverage transactions with small cash, say goodbye to your money.

feedData.title: Bitcoin and Crypto Stocks Poised for Institutional Surge, Bernstein Predicts $1 Million Milestone
feedData.subTitle:
Institutional adoption of Bitcoin (BTC) and related crypto assets is set to surge, according to a recent research report by Bernstein. The brokerage firm anticipates a substantial uptick in institutional interest, driven by forthcoming approvals of spot Bitcoin Exchange-Traded Funds (ETFs) on major wirehouses and large private bank platforms in the third and fourth quarters of 2024.&middot

For the full story, head over to TheCurrencyAnalytics.com.

feedData.title: WHAT ONCHAIN DATA SAYS ABOUT BTC?
feedData.subTitle:
Negative signals from the net flow side are needed to signal a reversal by bitcoin. It makes no sense to say that a reversal is coming without btc outflows from exchanges.

At the moment there are neither inflows nor outflows to inform about the direction of the market.

The last netflow signal came on June 11. and btc experienced a serial rise from 66k to 70k.

Written by KriptoBaykusV2

translatedData.content:
The problem is not that I'm upset, I'm very calm. I failed 3 times in crypto and then it presented me with life changing opportunities.
The problem is that Turkish investors, after scraping tooth and nail from the minimum wage of $450-500 per month that they earned with their hard work, making calculations and allocating 3-5 dollars for investment, then sink that money.
TÃ¼rkiye is a very assertive country in crypto and has a large community. Unfortunately, this brings with it many responsibilities and problems.
First of all, as a responsibility, everyone needs to be financially literate and adjust the damn Risk/Reward ratio well.
I'm surprised that the man so easily gives 5-10 thousand dollars, which he has saved for years, into the hands of hackers. Years of experience disappear in 1 minute.
In addition, the man with 10 thousand dollars enters the bull or bear market with zero risk management. Zero strategy and full of garbage projects. After one or two wins, the absolute end is already clear: bankruptcy.

No matter what we say, no one can become wise without being slapped by this market once or twice, maybe once in a million.

#Bitcoin #Binance #SEC #web3 #BinanceTournament

feedData.title: Key Reason Why Bitcoin (BTC) Is Crashing Despite Surging Stocks
feedData.subTitle:
The price of Bitcoin, the largest cryptocurrency by market cap, isÂ losing groundÂ despite the strength of the US stock market.Â 

The flagship cryptocurrency slipped to an intraday low of $64,544 after reaching a peak of $66,436, according to CoinGecko data.Â 

The recent bearishness could be related to the BitcoinÂ selling spree initiated by the German government. According to data provided by analytics platform Arkham Intelligence, the German government sent $65 million to two likely exchange deposits including Coinbase. Notably, Ki Young Ju, founder and CEO of on-chain analytics platform CryptoQuant, has noticed thatÂ selling pressure is primary origination from the Coinbase exchange.Â 

card

This comes after the German government sent $130 million worth of Bitcoin to various exchanges that included Kraken and Bitstamp. It continues to hold a whopping $3.05 billion worth of Bitcoin.Â 

German authorities famously seized a whopping 50,000 Bitcoins from Movie2k.to, the now-defunct piracy website, back in 2013.Â Â 

Nvidia keeps surgingÂ 

In the meantime, the benchmark S&P 500 index briefly surpassed 5,500 for the first time ever earlier today before paring some gains.Â 

The US stock market is being propped up by the remarkable surge of tech giant Nvidia. After becoming the most valuable public company in the world, Nvidia's market capitalization now stands at a staggering $3.4 trillion. This makes it bigger than France's GDP and the entire crypto industry.Â Â Â 

card

The majority of traders believe that the U.S. Federal Reserve is going to cut rates before November. This could give the battered cryptocurrency market some hope since a looser monetary policy would benefit crypto.Â
